Why do some antivirus software, such as Avast and Kaspersky, flag Verus software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP"?

Avast and Kaspersky may flag Verus software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP" (Potentially Unwanted Program) because Verus is a mining software, which can potentially be used by third parties to exploit your PC. These warnings are not necessarily indicating a virus or malware, but rather a caution that you are installing mining software.
